Nice features include 4-Wheel Power Disc Brakes, Painted Engine Bay, Ceramic Coated Headers with Stainless Steel Exhaust, and Modern Stereo. The exterior has been finished in a show quality Go Mango Paint finish with custom painted graphics. The interior has been completely restored and looks better than new. Selling At Auction - Las Vegas - 2018 This 1967 Mustang 390S-code convertible is equipped with the bench seat option, tilt-away steering column, AM/FM radio, and the Competition Handling Package which, of the 44,821 Mustang convertibles produced in 1967, only 21 were ordered with this option. The Competition Handling Package was only offered if the car was equipped with an S-code or a K-code engine and ordered with the GT package. This example is powered by a 390ci V8 big block engine mated to a 4-speed manual transmission and features the adjustable shocks and correct washer-style caps. It also features a glass rear window, courtesy light group, tinted glass, heavy-duty battery, and power steering. It was built and sold new in California and has the one-year-only 1967-style smog system installed. It has factory air conditioning with all of the correct components for a ?67 big block. This vehicle was completely disassembled and stripped to bare metal. It was in great condition with little metal work needed. The bare body was sealed with epoxy primer before the paint and body work were done. The bottom of the vehicle is epoxy primed in the correct shade of red oxide and detailed. Parts on the vehicle that are supposed to be phosphate coated are epoxy primed and painted to look like they were phosphate coated. The same goes for all of the natural-finished parts. The body is laser-straight and finished in mirror-like black base coat/clear coat paint with three coats of clear. The engine block, exhaust manifolds, intake manifold, and transmission are all date-coded and correct for a ?67 Mustang 390. The axle housing also is the correct big-bolt 9 housing that was available for 1967 Mustangs only. An Elite Marti Report and a copy of the original invoice are included.

Selling At Auction - Las Vegas - 2018 This Bullitt re-creation began its life as a real S-Code GT fastback, which is documented on its Marti Report. The drivetrain is all matching numbers, including the rebuilt original 390ci Hi-Po engine, the 4-speed manual transmission and the 9 rear end. It was also factory-optioned with the GT Equipment Group. Originally Acapulco Blue, it is now beautifully finished in Bullitt-correct Highland Green exterior paint. It has been professionally restored and has just 10 test miles since its completion. The car is factory-fresh from top to bottom, down to the red oxide primer on the underside. This fastback is rock solid, rust-free and bondo-free, and its all-steel body has a great fit. It is equipped with power front disc brakes, power steering, fold-down rear seat, functional hood-mounted turn signals, tachometer and upper console. The interior is in good condition and is factory-correct, from the cosmetics and trim to the correct tachometer red line. This Bullitt example is correct in replicating all of the unique nuances of both Bullitt cars used in the movie. The lower rocker molding, signal light and side marker bezels are painted in the body color, the rear tail panel is blacked out, the rear gas cap is blacked out, the correct Torq Thrust-style rims wear blackwall tires, and the fender and grille emblems have been removed. It has the correct Hurst 4-speed shifter, painted 3-spoke steering wheel with the GT500 center cap, single dual-exhaust tips, and deluxe interior with wood-grain and tachometer, clock and radio. The exterior antenna, dual-exhaust rear valance and passenger side mirror have been removed. The engine compartment is period-correct and highly detailed, right down to the factory decals. This chassis and underside are clean. In addition it comes with a gorgeous, professionally assembled Bullitt/Steve McQueen movie wall display with many photos, including the chase scene and prop plates. It is completed with an authentic signature of Steve McQueen and a Certificate of Authenticity.
Rebuilt 351 Cleveland engine with full length headers and new Flow Master exhaust.
Four speed manual transmission with new Hurst shifter.

Selling At Auction - Las Vegas - 2018 Born as a San Jose 390-4V fastback with 4-speed manual transmission, this rust-free, uncut California car underwent a total transformation. Media-blasted to bare metal, the Highland Green paint is accented only by subtle billet amenities and professionally restored bright trim. The engine is a professionally built Genesis big-block 427ci side-oiler. The 427 was stroked to 482ci and given an Edelbrock all aluminum top-end kit, MSD ignition system and MSD Atomic fuel injection with completely programmable hand-held plug-in unit. 4-wheel Wilwood brakes provide stopping power. This Mustang is also equipped with TCP suspension and coilovers at each wheel, sub-frame connectors, 3-link 9 Currie rear end, electric power-assisted steering, Vintage Air, custom ceramic long headers, full MagnaFlow exhaust, tinted windows, all-new wiring, carpet, upholstery and Dynamat insulation throughout, Ididit tilt column, big Griffin aluminum radiator, two programmable electric fans, TCP manual rack & pinion steering, and a TMI custom trunk insert. A stock-appearing modern stereo is boosted by a Kenwood amp mounted in the fully customized trunk interior. All LED lights and Auto Meter Phantom gauges finish out the sleek interior. A Ford Toploader 4-speed manual transmission was professionally rebuilt with Hurst shifter. With just under 100 test miles, it is ready for the road.

This 1968 Ford Mustang was produced in San Jose, California as a C-code coupe and has since been rebuilt in the style of the Terlingua team cars of the 1960s. Power is from a freshly rebuilt 331ci stroker V8 paired with an overhauled 4-speed Toploader manual transmission, and extensive track-oriented modifications are detailed below. The car was purchased by the current owner in 2014 from his son-in-law, a Mustang and Shelby restoration specialist based outside Kansas city, Missouri who performed the build in the mid-1990s. It is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with records dating to 1999 and a clean Missouri title in the current owner's name. Just in!!  Here's a 1968 Mustang convertible that we just got in and is now available to purchase.  This vehicle came to us from the southern Iowa area where it spent is entire life. (DSO was also Des Moines)  The previous owners had this car for  a little more than 20 Years and as they got older the car didn't get driven as much so it was time to part with it.  This Mustang is nicely  equipped with power brakes, and a power top that is in working order.  If you take a look  under the hood you'll find a 200 inline 6 paired with a automatic transmission just as it would have came from Ford.  The color code on this car in N so it was a Diamond Blue car and has had a repaint in the past.  This is a very interesting color that appears to be white but has a blue cast to it   The interior appears to be in nice shape and is still the original Lt. Blue Vinyl with Dark Blue Kiwi Vinyl standard interior.  We would consider this a driver quality car that will have a few blemishes, nics, scratches, crack  in the paint/body and would be great for cruising to roll ins or just out for an afternoon in the sun.  You can take a look at the pics and video provide to see the tidy engine bay, trunk, interior.  Please feel free to give us a call at 507-386-1726 or email '

This Ford Mustang cabriolet was new delivered on the 1st of August 1967 in Omaha Nebraska. It is an A-Code V8 Mustang with the 4 barrel Holley carburator. The car has the original paint colour Lime Gold Metallic with a black leather interior. The car is in a very beautiful condition. In 2018 the V8 engine was fully rebuilt in our workshop. Furthermore the car has power steering and double exhaust. So an A-Code Mustang convertible, ready for lots of driving fun.
